subject: Mental Health
title: The Reward System Breaks Down
description: One-minute skill: The Reward System Breaks Down.

hook.text: Your favorite meal tastes bland. Your best friend's joke falls flat. Nothing feels good.

buildup.text: Depression blunts the brain's dopamine reward system, stealing the ability to feel pleasure.

discovery.text: This symptom, called anhedonia, is one of the hallmarks of major depression.

twist.text: The brain still processes rewards â€” it just can't feel them anymore.

climax.text: Anhedonia explains why depressed people withdraw from activities they once loved.

punchline.text: Joy doesn't vanish. The brain forgets how to taste it.
